Chief Operating Officer (COO) Job at UnoCasa Limited




        
    

        
        UnoCasa Limited - Our client is a forward-thinking digital lending company leveraging technology to provide fast, secure, and accessible credit solutions.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Chief Executive Officer (CEO)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The company is on a growth trajectory and seeks a dynamic COO to lead operational excellence, scale processes, and drive strategic initiatives in a fast-paced fintech environment.
	The COO will be responsible for overseeing the company’s ongoing operations, ensuring seamless execution of business strategies, and driving operational efficiency.
	This role requires a strong leader with a proven track record in fintech or digital lending, operational scaling, regulatory compliance, and cross-functional leadership.


Key Responsibilities


	Operational Leadership: Oversee daily operations across all business functions, including credit risk management, customer experience, product delivery, and technology integration.
	Strategy Execution: Translate the company’s strategic vision into actionable operational plans with measurable KPIs.
	Process Optimization: Develop, implement, and monitor efficient operational systems, processes, and best practices that align with growth targets.
	Risk & Compliance: Ensure adherence to regulatory requirements, data protection laws, and industry best practices for lending and financial services.
	Technology & Innovation: Collaborate with the CTO/Product team to optimize lending platforms, improve automation, and enhance customer experience.
	Team Leadership: Mentor and develop department heads; foster a high-performance, results-driven culture.
	Financial Stewardship: Partner with the CFO to manage budgets, optimize cost structures, and ensure operational profitability.
	Stakeholder Management: Maintain strong relationships with investors, regulators, vendors, and key partners.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field (MBA preferred).
	Minimum 10 years of experience in financial services, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role within fintech, digital lending, or banking.
	Strong knowledge of credit risk management, digital lending platforms, and loan portfolio management.
	Proven ability to scale operations in a high-growth, tech-driven environment.
	Excellent leadership, people management, and decision-making skills.
	Strong understanding of data analytics, KPIs, and operational metrics.
	Experience managing compliance with CBN regulations (or relevant local financial regulatory body) is a plus.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinker with strong execution skills
	Data-driven decision-making
	Strong problem-solving and crisis management abilities
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills
	Adaptability and resilience in a fast-paced environment.

title: Job Vacancies at UnoCasa Limited
content:
UnoCasa Limited - Our team comprises vibrant individuals who are passionate about providing strategic human resources support to businesses. Our drive is business success and because we know a chain is only as strong as its weakest link, we engage your team to ensure weak links do not exist.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Chief Executive Officer (CEO)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The company is on a growth trajectory and seeks a dynamic COO to lead operational excellence, scale processes, and drive strategic initiatives in a fast-paced fintech environment.
	The COO will be responsible for overseeing the company’s ongoing operations, ensuring seamless execution of business strategies, and driving operational efficiency.
	This role requires a strong leader with a proven track record in fintech or digital lending, operational scaling, regulatory compliance, and cross-functional leadership.


Key Responsibilities


	Operational Leadership: Oversee daily operations across all business functions, including credit risk management, customer experience, product delivery, and technology integration.
	Strategy Execution: Translate the company’s strategic vision into actionable operational plans with measurable KPIs.
	Process Optimization: Develop, implement, and monitor efficient operational systems, processes, and best practices that align with growth targets.
	Risk & Compliance: Ensure adherence to regulatory requirements, data protection laws, and industry best practices for lending and financial services.
	Technology & Innovation: Collaborate with the CTO/Product team to optimize lending platforms, improve automation, and enhance customer experience.
	Team Leadership: Mentor and develop department heads; foster a high-performance, results-driven culture.
	Financial Stewardship: Partner with the CFO to manage budgets, optimize cost structures, and ensure operational profitability.
	Stakeholder Management: Maintain strong relationships with investors, regulators, vendors, and key partners.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field (MBA preferred).
	Minimum 10 years of experience in financial services, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role within fintech, digital lending, or banking.
	Strong knowledge of credit risk management, digital lending platforms, and loan portfolio management.
	Proven ability to scale operations in a high-growth, tech-driven environment.
	Excellent leadership, people management, and decision-making skills.
	Strong understanding of data analytics, KPIs, and operational metrics.
	Experience managing compliance with CBN regulations (or relevant local financial regulatory body) is a plus.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinker with strong execution skills
	Data-driven decision-making
	Strong problem-solving and crisis management abilities
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills
	Adaptability and resilience in a fast-paced environment.


Application Closing Date: 29th August, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

2.) Head of Marketing (Real Estate Experience)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Head of Marketing is responsible for leading the end-to-end marketing strategy and execution.
	This includes managing all digital and traditional marketing activities, driving brand growth, and generating high-quality real estate leads.
	The ideal candidate must possess a strong background in real estate marketing, with proven experience in campaign management, digital visibility, event activation, and team leadership.


Key Responsibilities
Marketing Strategy & Execution:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive marketing strategy that aligns with the company's sales objectives and brand positioning.
	Lead quarterly and annual marketing plans for residential projects, property launches, and investment offerings.
	Plan and manage go-to-market strategies for new properties (pre-launch, launch, and post-launch).


Digital Marketing & Content Oversight:


	Oversee all digital campaigns (Meta, Google Ads, LinkedIn, etc.)—strategy, budget allocation, tracking, and performance optimization.
	Supervise and approve content (graphics, videos, copies) for social platforms including Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, and WhatsApp Business.
	Manage CRM tools, email marketing platforms (e.g., MailChimp), and lead generation funnels.


Field & Traditional Marketing:


	Coordinate field marketing activities such as open houses, roadshows, expos, activations, and event sponsorships.
	Oversee the production and distribution of marketing materials: flyers, banners, signage, outdoor media, and promotional items.
	Ensure strong neighborhood presence within key property locations.


Team Management & Coordination:


	Lead the internal marketing team: field marketers, content creators, graphic designers, videographers, and agency partners.
	Provide creative direction and performance feedback to both in-house and outsourced marketing talent.
	Establish KPIs and workflows to ensure timely and quality campaign delivery.


Analytics, Budgeting & Reporting:


	Monitor and report ROI on all paid campaigns and lead generation initiatives.
	Analyze market trends, customer behavior, and competitor activities to inform strategy.
	Prepare monthly performance reports and present findings to management.


Brand & Stakeholder Management:


	Ensure consistent brand identity across digital and offline channels.
	Represent the company in industry events, property expos, and marketing collaborations.
	Collaborate closely with Sales, Admin, and Project teams to maintain alignment and support business goals.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Mass Communication, or related field
	Minimum 5–7 years of experience in marketing, with at least 3 years in real estate marketing
	Demonstrated success in both digital and traditional marketing roles
	Experience leading a marketing team and managing cross-functional projects
	Professional certifications in digital marketing or real estate (an added advantage).


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Strategic thinking with ability to balance long-term brand growth and short-term lead generation
	Strong knowledge of the Nigerian real estate market (especially Lagos)
	Digital marketing expertise: Meta Ads, Google Ads, SEO, content strategy, etc.
	Proficiency in tools like Canva, MailChimp, Meta Business Suite, Google Analytics, and CRM platforms
	Excellent written and verbal communication
	Team leadership, campaign planning, and project management skills.


Application Closing Date: 25th August, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Executive Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Reports To: Chief Executive Officer

About the Role


	This is a rare and high-impact dual-role opportunity for a smart, discreet, and detail-oriented professional to serve as both Executive Personal Assistant and Office Administrator to a dynamic, mission-driven CEO and private equity team.
	You will work at the intersection of executive leadership, operational excellence, and personal support—playing a vital role in enabling the CEO to thrive across her multiple commitments as a private equity executive and global thought leader.
	The ideal candidate is a master of discretion, organization, and follow-through, and is equally comfortable managing a complex calendar, coordinating with investors, or making sure the boardroom is prepped for the next big meeting.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Executive & Personal Support:


	Manage the CEO’s integrated calendar, including board meetings, LP calls, investor roadshows, speaking engagements, family obligations, and wellness time
	Prioritize, flag, and triage emails, WhatsApp messages, and documents—ensuring nothing falls through the cracks
	Prepare briefing folders, notes, and decks for meetings and global engagements
	Coordinate international and local travel, including complex itineraries, hotel bookings, and visa requirements
	Support all CEO’s responsibilities, including scheduling, reminders, etc.


Office Administration & Operations:


	Serve as the CEO and the Office Manager: manage supplies, space setup, boardroom readiness, visitor coordination, events organization, and vendor relationships
	Maintain an organized filing system (physical and digital) for confidential documents, board papers, NDAs, and fund materials
	Track and reconcile CEO-related expenses and reimbursements in collaboration with finance
	Provide support in onboarding and coordinating logistics for visiting board members, speakers, consultants, or interns
	Ensure the CEO’s office environment is calm, functional, and high-performing.


Executive Communications & Content Coordination:


	Support the CEO’s thought leadership content pipeline, including drafting LinkedIn posts, proofreading speeches, or coordinating media responses
	Create visually clear briefing decks, summaries, and one-pagers when needed (Canva or PowerPoint)
	Liaise with communications, investor relations, and impact teams to coordinate messaging and align schedules.


CEO Workflow & Time Management:


	Build and maintain a weekly dashboard for the CEO
	Monitor internal and external deliverables, proactively reminding relevant parties and escalating bottlenecks
	Act as a “gatekeeper and gateway”—protecting time while also maintaining warmth and accessibility where appropriate.


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s Degree or executive assistant certifications a plus
	5+ years of experience in executive assistant and/or office manager roles, preferably in high-performing or multinational environments
	Experience supporting C-suite executives in finance, private equity, energy, or policy environments
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Availability for travel and flexible hours based on CEO’s calendar.


Key Attributes & Competencies:


	Highly Discreet & Trustworthy: Can handle sensitive information and high-stakes interactions with absolute confidentiality
	Hyper-Organized & Detail-Oriented: Structured, neat, and meticulous about follow-through
	Poised & Professional: Represents the office of the CEO with polish and diplomacy, internally and externally
	Emotionally Intelligent: Sensitive to context, tone, and power dynamics across diverse stakeholders
	Tech-Savvy: Fluent with productivity tools (Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, Zoom, Trello/Asana, Notion, Canva)
	Solution-Oriented: You solve problems before they arise and anticipate needs ahead of time
	Globally Aware, Locally Grounded: Comfortable in high-level international engagements, while managing day-to-day office realities in Nigeria.


Salary
N400,000 - N700,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 15th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Jobs@unocasaltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

	Through digital channels (LinkedIn,&nbsp;referrals, networking, etc.)

Sales Officer Job at Lamlan Digital Solution Limited




        
    

        
        Lamlan Digital Solution Limited is a multi-national digital marketing agency that  partners with ambitious startups and businesses to build powerful brand presence and drive revenue through paid ads, content marketing, and digital strategy. We’re not just marketers we’re business enablers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Officer

Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	Now we’re growing, and we need a driven Sales Officer who knows how to turn conversations into contracts.
	We’re looking for a Commission-Only Sales Officer who thrives in performance-based roles and is passionate about connecting brands with marketing solutions that drive results.


This role is ideal for someone who is:


	Motivated by uncapped earnings
	Confident in client acquisition and lead nurturing
	Resourceful, persuasive, and skilled in digital sales
	Comfortable working remotely and independently
	You’ll play a pivotal role in helping Lamlan Digital Solutions Limited attract and onboard new clients in sectors such as fashion, beauty, tech, e-commerce, and professional services.


Key Responsibilities
Source and identify new business leads:


	Through digital channels (LinkedIn, referrals, networking, etc.)
	Reach out to potential clients via email, DMs, calls, and meetings
	Pitch Lamlan Digital Solution’s services persuasively and confidently
	Schedule and conduct virtual discovery meetings
	Follow up with leads consistently and close deals
	Collaborate with the strategy team to align offers with client pain points
	Maintain accurate records of all outreach and conversions.


Earnings & Commission Structure:


	20%–30% commission on every successful client contract closed
	Bonuses available for meeting monthly
	No cap on earnings the more you close, the more you earn
	All tools and pitch assets provided by the agency.


Requirements
Ideal Candidate:


	1–3 years of experience in sales, preferably in a digital agency or service-based business
	Proven track record of hitting or exceeding targets
	Knowledge of digital marketing, social media, or creative services is a plus
	Excellent communication and follow-up skills
	Self-motivated, organized, and result-oriented
	Based in Nigeria, with strong understanding of local business landscape
	Comfortable working remotely and independently.


Benefits
What You Get:


	Commission Only
	5%–15% commission per closed deal (plus performance bonuses)
	Flexible working hours manage your own schedule
	Uncapped commission potential
	Access to agency-branded sales pitch decks and training
	Exposure to exciting clients across industries
	The opportunity to grow with the agency long-term


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter telling why they’d be a great fit to: Hr.lamlandigital@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	At Lamlan Digital Solutions, we believe in bold moves, real results, and collaborative energy.
	We empower you to own your space, learn fast, and build a name for yourself.
	If you’re a go-getter with a passion for sales and growth, you’ll love it here.

{

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Human Capital Management",
  "description": "Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited was incorporated in December 2009 with the business objective of providing financial service to micro clients who were excluded from the mainstream financial system. It commenced operations in June 2010 upon obtaining a Unit Microfinance Banking License from the Central Bank of Nigeria. It later obtained a State Microfinance Banking License in 2016.&nbsp;Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited&rsquo;s financial inclusion effort focuses on promoting savings culture, access to credit facilities for income-generation purposes and reducing vulnerability to risk through micro insurance.

The Bank&rsquo;s major strategic focus employs the group lending methodology in its operations with a leaning towards women. It believes in the commitment of women folk to work hard and help their families conquer poverty. As such, more than 95% of the Bank&rsquo;s lending activities focuses on women. The success of the bank&rsquo;s group lending activities largely depends on group solidarity and cohesion. The success recorded by the bank in its lending program has earned it strategic partnership with the Bank of Industry (BOI) and the Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN) among others. The combination of cutting-edge technology, a strong and committed Board of Directors and motivated employees has helped the Bank to create a brand widely accepted by its teeming clients in Lagos. It is now expanding its frontiers in a scaling program aimed at delivering improved value to its stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Human Capital Management
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Strategic HR Leadership:


	Design and execute people strategies aligned with Bosak&rsquo; s values of simplicity, professionalism, and respect.
	Advise executive leadership on workforce planning, succession, and organizational design to support branch expansion and financial inclusion goals.
	Lead the development and enforcement of HR policies and processes in line with regulatory and ethical standards.


Talent Acquisition &amp; Retention:


	Oversee recruitment across business units, with emphasis on field-based roles such as loan officers and deposit mobilizers.
	Develop microfinance-specific talent pipelines and promote diversity and inclusion in hiring.
	Implement retention strategies including welfare programs, competitive remuneration, and employee engagement initiatives.


Learning &amp; Development:


	Identify industry-specific skill gaps and build training frameworks that emphasize credit risk, KYC, customer relations, and digital banking.
	Drive internal talent development through mentorship, coaching, and structured career paths.
	Promote continuous learning and development through training platforms and cross-functional exposure.


Performance Management:


	Establish and monitor KPIs that align employee output with institutional targets (e.g., loan repayment, deposit growth).
	Lead the annual performance appraisal process with an emphasis on fairness, feedback, and measurable development.
	Foster a high-performance culture through clear accountability and reward systems.


Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure all HR practices are fully compliant with Nigerian labor laws, CBN regulations, and relevant microfinance standards.
	Maintain secure employee records, oversee payroll, and ensure data privacy in line with NDPR.
	Drive workplace discipline and risk mitigation through consistent enforcement of codes of conduct.
	Employee Engagement &amp; Organizational Culture
	Champion employee wellness, inclusion, and morale through structured programs and an open-door policy.
	Encourage a purpose-driven workplace culture centered on service to underserved communities.
	Manage conflict resolution, grievance redress, and change management initiatives with empathy and professionalism.


HR Operations &amp; Analytics:


	Supervise end-to-end HR operations including onboarding, off boarding, benefits administration, and policy reviews.
	Use data analytics to track turnover, training ROI, and productivity metrics to inform strategic decisions.
	Prepare and manage HR budgets, optimizing resource allocation without compromising staff welfare.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	A recognized professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, and CIPD) is mandatory.
	Minimum of 7 years of post- NYSC HR experience, with 3 years in a managerial role within the financial or microfinance sector.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor law, CBN regulatory requirements, and HR compliance procedures.
	Demonstrated success in recruitment, staff development, succession planning, and performance management.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
	Proficiency in HR information systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and payroll management platforms.
	A strong commitment to financial inclusion and working with grassroots communities.


Why Work with Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited?


	If you desire to work in an organization where employee motivation is key and passion is rewarded, then Bosak MFB might be the place for you.
	We are committed to building an open and rewarding work environment where all employees have equal opportunities for growth to realize their full potential.
	Our remuneration and employee welfare packages are among the best in the industry.


Benefits


	Comprehensive HMO
	Continuous Training and Development
	Leave and Passage allowance
	Opportunities for career growth in a mission-driven institution.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@bosakmfb.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Head, Human Capital Management&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

Head, Human Capital Management Job at Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited




        
    

        
        Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited was incorporated in December 2009 with the business objective of providing financial service to micro clients who were excluded from the mainstream financial system. It commenced operations in June 2010 upon obtaining a Unit Microfinance Banking License from the Central Bank of Nigeria. It later obtained a State Microfinance Banking License in 2016. Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited’s financial inclusion effort focuses on promoting savings culture, access to credit facilities for income-generation purposes and reducing vulnerability to risk through micro insurance.
     

            
    



The Bank’s major strategic focus employs the group lending methodology in its operations with a leaning towards women. It believes in the commitment of women folk to work hard and help their families conquer poverty. As such, more than 95% of the Bank’s lending activities focuses on women. The success of the bank’s group lending activities largely depends on group solidarity and cohesion. The success recorded by the bank in its lending program has earned it strategic partnership with the Bank of Industry (BOI) and the Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN) among others. The combination of cutting-edge technology, a strong and committed Board of Directors and motivated employees has helped the Bank to create a brand widely accepted by its teeming clients in Lagos. It is now expanding its frontiers in a scaling program aimed at delivering improved value to its stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Human Capital Management
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Strategic HR Leadership:


	Design and execute people strategies aligned with Bosak’ s values of simplicity, professionalism, and respect.
	Advise executive leadership on workforce planning, succession, and organizational design to support branch expansion and financial inclusion goals.
	Lead the development and enforcement of HR policies and processes in line with regulatory and ethical standards.


Talent Acquisition & Retention:


	Oversee recruitment across business units, with emphasis on field-based roles such as loan officers and deposit mobilizers.
	Develop microfinance-specific talent pipelines and promote diversity and inclusion in hiring.
	Implement retention strategies including welfare programs, competitive remuneration, and employee engagement initiatives.


Learning & Development:


	Identify industry-specific skill gaps and build training frameworks that emphasize credit risk, KYC, customer relations, and digital banking.
	Drive internal talent development through mentorship, coaching, and structured career paths.
	Promote continuous learning and development through training platforms and cross-functional exposure.


Performance Management:


	Establish and monitor KPIs that align employee output with institutional targets (e.g., loan repayment, deposit growth).
	Lead the annual performance appraisal process with an emphasis on fairness, feedback, and measurable development.
	Foster a high-performance culture through clear accountability and reward systems.


Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure all HR practices are fully compliant with Nigerian labor laws, CBN regulations, and relevant microfinance standards.
	Maintain secure employee records, oversee payroll, and ensure data privacy in line with NDPR.
	Drive workplace discipline and risk mitigation through consistent enforcement of codes of conduct.
	Employee Engagement & Organizational Culture
	Champion employee wellness, inclusion, and morale through structured programs and an open-door policy.
	Encourage a purpose-driven workplace culture centered on service to underserved communities.
	Manage conflict resolution, grievance redress, and change management initiatives with empathy and professionalism.


HR Operations & Analytics:


	Supervise end-to-end HR operations including onboarding, off boarding, benefits administration, and policy reviews.
	Use data analytics to track turnover, training ROI, and productivity metrics to inform strategic decisions.
	Prepare and manage HR budgets, optimizing resource allocation without compromising staff welfare.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	A recognized professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, and CIPD) is mandatory.
	Minimum of 7 years of post- NYSC HR experience, with 3 years in a managerial role within the financial or microfinance sector.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor law, CBN regulatory requirements, and HR compliance procedures.
	Demonstrated success in recruitment, staff development, succession planning, and performance management.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
	Proficiency in HR information systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and payroll management platforms.
	A strong commitment to financial inclusion and working with grassroots communities.


Why Work with Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited?


	If you desire to work in an organization where employee motivation is key and passion is rewarded, then Bosak MFB might be the place for you.
	We are committed to building an open and rewarding work environment where all employees have equal opportunities for growth to realize their full potential.
	Our remuneration and employee welfare packages are among the best in the industry.


Benefits


	Comprehensive HMO
	Continuous Training and Development
	Leave and Passage allowance
	Opportunities for career growth in a mission-driven institution.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@bosakmfb.com using “Head, Human Capital Management” as the subject of the mail.
